item.title: 第一品牌贷款人向 "黑盒子 "伸出援手
item.description: First Brands 集团的贷款人因该汽车零部件供应商使用资产负债表外融资而焦头烂额，他们迅速筹集了 11 亿美元的紧急救命钱，以防止该公司彻底倒闭。但是，他们的律师说，为了完成这笔贷款，这些公司不得不放弃了通常情况下对此类巨额贷款所要求的尽职调查。【原文：First Brands Group lenders burned by the auto parts supplier’s use of off-balance-sheet financing quickly assembled a $1.1 billion emergency lifeline to prevent the business from completely unraveling. But to pull it off their lawyer said the firms had to forgo the amount of diligence they’d normally require for such a sizable loan.】

item.title: 巴西与中国联手创建新的投资基金
item.description: 巴西开发银行和中国进出口银行同意设立一个 10 亿美元的基金，投资于能源转型、基础设施、采矿、农业和人工智能等领域。【原文：Brazil’s Development Bank and the Export-Import Bank of China agreed to create a $1 billion fund that will invest in sectors such as energy transition, infrastructure, mining, agriculture and artificial intelligence.】

item.title: MUFG 在日本大力发展财富管理业务，招聘更多银行家
item.description: 日本最大的银行正在招聘更多的应届毕业生和经验丰富的专家，以求在日本不断增长的财富管理市场上分一杯羹。【原文：Japan’s largest bank is recruiting more new graduates and experienced specialists as it seeks a bigger piece of the country’s growing wealth management market.】

item.title: 应用材料公司警告中国最新限制措施将冲击其销售额
item.description: 美国最大的半导体生产设备制造商应用材料公司（Applied Materials Inc.【原文：Applied Materials Inc., the largest US maker of machinery used to manufacture semiconductors, said an expansion of rules that restrict the export of its products to China will take another chunk out of its revenue.】

item.title: 高管称 Alphabet 计划出售或分拆 Verily 部门
item.description: 一位高级管理人员周四作证说，Alphabet 公司过去两年来一直在努力使其生命科学部门 Verily 在技术上脱钩，以便出售或分拆。【原文：Alphabet Inc. has been working for the past two years to technologically decouple its life sciences unit Verily so that it can be sold or spun off, a senior executive testified Thursday.】

item.title: 美国银行储备进一步下降，跌破 3 万亿美元关键关口
item.description: 作为美联储决定继续缩减资产负债表的一个关键因素，美国银行系统的储备金连续第八周下滑，创下了低于 3 万亿美元的新纪录。【原文：The US banking system’s reserves, a key factor in the Federal Reserve’s decision to keep shrinking its balance sheet, tumbled for the eighth straight week to a new mark below $3 trillion.】

item.title: Golub 的私人信用 CLO 为保险公司提供了罕见的期限游戏
item.description: 私人信贷公司 Golub Capital 出售了一种抵押贷款义务，该义务将投资者锁定在证券上的时间比一般交易更长，因为保险公司为寻找持有时间更长的资产而将资金投入私人信贷。【原文：Private credit firm Golub Capital sold a collateralized loan obligation that locks investors into the securities for longer than typical deals, as insurers pour money into private credit in their search for longer-held assets.】

item.title: Enbridge 首席执行官称加拿大正因美国项目而失去投资
item.description: Enbridge Inc. 首席执行官格雷格-埃贝尔（Greg Ebel）表示，由于加拿大的法规和冗长的审批程序使得美国的竞争力下降，因此该公司正将大部分投资引向美国。【原文：Enbridge Inc. is channeling most of its investment into the US as Canadian regulations and lengthy approvals make the country less competitive, Chief Executive Officer Greg Ebel said.】

item.title: OpenAI、Anthropic 在质疑声中彰显人工智能的经济价值
item.description: OpenAI、Anthropic 和其他初创公司正试图让人们更清楚地了解人工智能在工作场所的表现。但首先...【原文：OpenAI, Anthropic and other startups are attempting to provide more clarity on how AI performs in the workplace. But first…】

item.title: 微软扩大与日本 Shizen Energy 的清洁能源交易
item.description: 微软公司与日本 Shizen Energy 公司签署了一批新的可再生能源协议，这是一家全球技术公司为确保清洁电力供应所做的最新努力。【原文：Microsoft Corp. has signed a new batch of renewable energy deals with Japan-based Shizen Energy Inc., the latest effort by a global technology company to secure clean electricity.】

item.title: 纽约市的房租太高了。即使你的收入达到六位数
item.description:
在今天的 Big Take 播客中：如果纽约的六位数收入者都无法在纽约安居乐业，还有谁能呢？我们将为您解读美国第一大城市受挤压的租房市场。【原文：

On today’s Big Take podcast: If six-figure earners in New York can’t make it there, who can? We unpack the squeezed rental market in America’s largest city.

】

item.title: 费城机构寻求美国贷款以更换火灾后的列车
item.description: 费城公交系统在今年接连发生火灾后，可能会寻求美国政府贷款购买新的通勤列车。【原文：Philadelphia’s transit system may seek a loan from the US government to buy new commuter trains after a rash of fires this year.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局和国家运输安全委员会调查亚马逊无人机在凤凰城附近送货时相撞事故
item.description: 联邦监管机构正在调查亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.【原文：Federal regulators are investigating two crashes by Amazon.com Inc. delivery drones near Phoenix.】

item.title: 惠誉称：类似美洲杯的事件威胁巴西债务市场
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）表示，随着一系列信用事件对当地债务市场造成冲击，巴西企业未来可能面临流动性收紧的问题。【原文：Brazilian companies may face tighter liquidity ahead as a series of credit events rattles local debt markets, Fitch Ratings said.】

item.title: 优步收购数据标签初创公司，推动人工智能服务销售
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. has bought Belgian startup Segments.ai as the ride-hailing company seeks to expand its nascent data-labeling business.】

item.title: Ninepoint 在 Cenovus 交易投票前退出 MEG 能源公司股份
item.description: MEG Energy Corp. 的最大股东之一在对该公司的收购要约进行关键投票之前出售了其持仓，担心来自 Cenovus Energy Inc. 和 Strathcona Resources Ltd. 的竞争性收购要约可能会破裂。【原文：One of MEG Energy Corp.’s largest shareholders sold its position ahead of a key vote on a takeover offer for the company, concerned that competing bids from both Cenovus Energy Inc. and Strathcona Resources Ltd. may fall apart.】

item.title: Raistone 将大规模裁员归咎于第一品牌 80% 的曝光率
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Raistone 是一家贸易金融专业公司，在 First Brands 集团破产后裁员数十人。【原文：Raistone, the trade-finance specialist that has laid off dozens of employees in the wake of First Brands Group’s bankruptcy, told employees it relied on the auto-parts supplier for more than 80% of its revenue, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称美国经济仍在 "相当稳健地 "增长
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，其员工提供的新数据表明劳动力市场保持稳定。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said new data produced by his staff suggests the labor market remains stable.】

item.title: 比特币自创纪录以来首次触及 120,000 美元
item.description: 比特币自七周前创下历史新高以来首次升至 120,000 美元，因为市场猜测美国政府关门将促使投资者转向避险资产。【原文：Bitcoin rose to $120,000 for the first time since setting a record high seven weeks ago as speculation increases that the US government shutdown will drive investors to safe-haven assets.】

item.title: 梅洛尼力推减税和国防政策，意大利赤字率达到 3
item.description: 意大利内阁批准了一项预算，其特点是今年的赤字仅占产出的 3%，这使得总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）领导的政府可以留出更多资金用于减税和国防。【原文：Italy’s cabinet approved a budget featuring a deficit at just 3% of output this year, allowing Premier Giorgia Meloni’s government to set aside more money for tax cuts and defense.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚生态石油公司为闲置油港注入新活力
item.description: 哥伦比亚太平洋沿岸的一个港口因输油管道遭到一系列袭击而闲置了近两年，如今可能迎来一条新的生命线。【原文：A Colombian port on the Pacific coast that’s been idle for nearly two years following a series of attacks on a pipeline could see a new lifeline.】

item.title: 得克萨斯大学将两项贷款计划提高 43%，达到 25 亿美元
item.description: 得克萨斯大学系统将其部分短期贷款计划增加到 25 亿美元，将其两个商业票据系列的容量提高了 40% 以上。【原文：The University of Texas System increased part of its short-term lending program to $2.5 billion, boosting the capacity of two of its commercial paper series by more than 40%.】

item.title: 泰勒-斯威夫特的新专辑将由泰勒-斯威夫特之外的所有人推广
item.description:
她将于本周发行第十二张专辑《The Life of a Showgirl》。各品牌、发行商和平台都在为宣传这张专辑而争先恐后。【原文：

She’ll release her twelfth album, The Life of a Showgirl, this week. Brands, distributors and platforms are tripping over each other to promote it. 

】

item.title: 瑞银基金面临第一品牌 5 亿美元的风险敞口
item.description: 法庭文件显示，瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）旗下的基金通过各种投资策略，面临破产汽车零部件供应商 First Brands 集团超过 5 亿美元的风险敞口，其中一家基金是最大的无担保债权人。【原文：Funds under the UBS Group AG umbrella face more than half a billion dollars of exposure to bankrupt auto-parts supplier First Brands Group through various investment strategies, with one ranking as the biggest unsecured creditor, court documents show.】

item.title: 顶级外汇预测师称美联储讲话是美元在关门之际的关键所在
item.description: 据一位顶级外汇货币预测专家称，随着美国政府关门拖入第二天，美元可能会进一步走软。【原文：The dollar will likely weaken further as the US government shutdown drags into a second day, according to a top foreign-exchange currency forecaster.】

item.title: 据说 TK 电梯将选择罗斯柴尔德和 Lilja 作为 IPO 顾问
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，TK 电梯的私募股权所有者已选择罗斯柴尔德公司（Rothschild & Co.【原文：TK Elevator’s private equity owners have selected Rothschild & Co. and Lilja & Co. to advise on a planned initial public offering of the company that could be one of Europe’s largest listings in years, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中银认为市场过于关注其核心通胀指标
item.description: 加拿大央行（Bank of Canada）继续淡化其首选的基本价格压力衡量标准，称其正在权衡一套更广泛的衡量标准，这些标准表明核心通胀率更接近其 2% 的目标。【原文：The Bank of Canada continued to fade its preferred measures of underlying price pressures, saying it’s weighing a broader suite of gauges that suggest core inflation is closer to its 2% target.】

item.title: 各国警告：加密货币法案将阻碍对欺诈行为的起诉
item.description: 就在联邦对数字资产公司的执法力度急剧下降的同时，各州当局也表示担心，他们起诉加密犯罪分子的能力很快就会大打折扣。【原文：Just as federal enforcement against digital-asset companies has dropped precipitously, state authorities are voicing concern that their ability to prosecute crypto criminals will soon be vastly diminished.】

item.title: 西方石油公司首席执行官称她 "很乐意 "取消 SEC 季度报告
item.description: 西方石油公司（Occidental Petroleum Corp.首席执行官 Vicki Hollub 表示，如果美国证券交易委员会允许，她支持取消三个月的财务报告周期。【原文：Occidental Petroleum Corp. Chief Executive Officer Vicki Hollub said she’s all for doing away with three-month financial reporting cycles if the US Securities and Exchange Commission allows it.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长维勒鲁瓦敦促采取大胆措施加强欧元的全球作用
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪呼吁决策者加强欧元的国际作用，包括增加安全资产的发行。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council Member Francois Villeroy de Galhau called for policymakers to strengthen the international role of the euro, including by increasing the issuance of safe assets.】
